ETYMOLOGY: From Latin ingredientem, present participle of ingredi 'to go into, enter', from in- 'into' + gradi 'to walk, step'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Any of the foods or substances that are combined to make a particular dish; a component part of any mixture.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 制作特定菜肴或混合物所用的任何食物或物质；组成部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The recipe calls for fresh, organic ingredients.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个食谱要求使用新鲜的有机食材。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A quality or factor contributing to a particular result or outcome.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 促成特定结果或产出的品质或因素。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Trust is a key ingredient for a successful relationship.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 信任是成功关系的关键要素。
